title: Tunic Fragment, 8th–10th century
medium:
Medium: wool
Technique: tapestry weave with split and dovetailed interlocking, eccentric weft, wrapping
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 34.9 x 65.4 cm (13 3/4 x 25 3/4 in.)
description: Section of a tunic, probably for a child, with the neck opening in the center; the front and back are identical panels. Below the neck are two roundels each with a figure wearing a mantle and carrying a shield. Below the band hang two figures on chains. The panel is bordered by a series of small roundels containing rosettes or birds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Tunic Fragment, 8th–10th century. Medium: wool
Technique: tapestry weave with split and dovetailed interlocking, eccentric weft, wrapping. Gift of Clara Waldeck. 1969-170-28.
